item.title: The Disappearance of Alissa Turney
item.description: In 2001, 17-year-old Alissa Turney vanished from Phoenix, Arizona. Her sister continues to speak out, pushing for answers in a case that remains unsolved after more than two decades.

media:content.media:title: The Disappearance of Alissa Turney
media:content.media:description: In 2001, 17-year-old Alissa Turney vanished from Phoenix, Arizona. Her sister continues to speak out, pushing for answers in a case that remains unsolved after more than two decades.

item.title: The Case of Ryan Borgwardt’s Fake Death
item.description: Ryan Borgwardt staged his own death to be with a woman he met online, leaving his family behind. The case revealed shocking deception and a double life that ended in criminal charges.

item.title: The Legal Troubles Facing Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs
item.description: After federal raids on his homes, Sean “Diddy” Combs faces multiple lawsuits, including claims from producer Rodney “Lil Rod” Jones and ex-girlfriend Cassie Ventura. Investigations are ongoing.

item.title: Alex Woodworth Found Himself Inside a Love Triangle That Turned Fatal
item.description: In 2018, Alex Woodworth was murdered in Eau Claire, Wisconsin, in a case involving a love triangle with Ezra McCandless. She was convicted of first-degree intentional homicide.

item.title: What Happened to Shanann Watts?
item.description: In 2018, Shanann Watts and her two daughters were murdered in Colorado. Her husband, Chris Watts, confessed and is serving multiple life sentences. The case drew worldwide attention.

item.title: The Disappearance of Nathaniel Holmes
item.description: In 1981, 5-year-old Nathaniel Holmes disappeared after leaving school in New Jersey. Despite decades of searching, his case remains unsolved and his family continues to seek answers.

item.title: The Disappearance of Johnny Gosch
item.description: In 1982, 12-year-old Johnny Gosch vanished while delivering newspapers in Iowa. His case became one of America’s most famous missing child investigations and remains unsolved today.

item.title: The Disappearance of Jacobo Grinberg
item.description: In 1994, Mexican neuroscientist Jacobo Grinberg vanished without a trace. Known for studying brain activity and consciousness, his disappearance remains one of Mexico’s greatest unsolved mysteries.

item.title: They Lost Their Family Members IN 2 SECONDS����
item.description: In 2013, Texas teen Ethan Couch killed four people while driving drunk. His defense cited “affluenza,” sparking outrage after he avoided prison. He later served time for probation violations.

item.title: What Happened to Skylar Neese?
item.description: In 2012, 16-year-old Skylar Neese was murdered by her two best friends in West Virginia. Both were later convicted, and the case drew national attention to teen violence and betrayal.

item.title: What Happened to Chance Englebert?
item.description: In 2019, 25-year-old Chance Englebert walked away after a family gathering in Nebraska and was never seen again. Despite searches and tips, his disappearance remains unsolved.

item.title: Their Plane Crashed. Four Kids Survived 40 Days in the Amazon
item.description: After a plane crash in May 2023, four Indigenous children survived 40 days alone in the Amazon jungle before rescuers found them. Their story of resilience captured global attention.

item.title: What’s Really Brewing Behind This Famous Tea
item.description: Celestial Seasonings, America’s top tea brand, began with founder Mo Siegel and friends in the Rockies. But its roots also link back to a little-known group called Urantia, raising questions about its past.

item.title: The Case of Caylee Marie Anthony
item.description: In 2008, 2-year-old Caylee Anthony was reported missing in Florida. Her mother, Casey Anthony, was later tried and acquitted of murder in a case that drew national attention and debate.

item.title: The Case of Michelle Wilkins
item.description: In 2015, Michelle Wilkins survived a brutal attack in Colorado after responding to a Craigslist ad. Her case raised questions about online safety and how the justice system handles such crimes.

item.title: The Unsolved Mystery of Marissa DiNapoli
item.description: The Unsolved Mystery of Marissa DiNapoli

item.title: Life360 App Finds Missing 13-Year-Old
item.description: When 13-year-old Savannah Copeland went missing, police used the Life360 tracking app to help locate her. The case highlighted how technology can play a key role in finding missing children.

item.title: Marriage Ends in Tragedy: Cory Johnson
item.description: Cory Johnson’s marriage lasted only eight days before it ended in tragedy. This case explores what happened, the investigation, and how justice was pursued.

item.title: The Mystery in Room 1046
item.description: In 1935, Roland T. Owen was found tortured and murdered in Kansas City’s Hotel President, Room 1046. Nearly 90 years later, his identity and killer remain a chilling mystery.

item.title: The Disappearance of Katelyn Markham
item.description: In 2011, 21-year-old Katelyn Markham vanished from her Ohio home. Her remains were later found, and in 2023 her fiancé John Carter was charged with her murder after more than a decade of mystery.
